TypeSignature.Value: .class public interface auto ansi abstract Window

Docs.summary: Represents a window.

remarks.para: Many document characteristics, such as scroll bars and rulers, are actually properties of the window. The object is a member of the collection. The collection for the object contains all the windows in the application, whereas the collection for the object contains only the windows that display the specified document.
Use Windows(), where is the window name or the index number, to return a single object.
The index number is the number to the left of the window name on the Window menu.
Use the method or the method to add a new window to the collection.
A colon (:) and a number appear in the window caption when more than one window is open for a document.
When you switch the view to print preview, a new window is created. This window is removed from the collection when you close print preview.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Activate() runtime managed

Docs.summary: Activates the specified object.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Active As Boolean
public: property bool Active { bool get(); };

Docs.summary: True if the specified window is active.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property ActivePane As Pane
public: property Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::Pane ^ ActivePane { Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::Pane ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Returns a object that represents the active pane for the specified window.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Application As Application

Docs.summary: Returns a object that represents the Microsoft Word application.

MemberSignature.Value: Default Public Property Caption As String
public: property System::String ^ default { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };
member this.Caption : string with get, set

Docs.summary: Returns or sets the caption text for the specified document or application window.

remarks.para: To change the caption of the application window to the default text, set this property to an empty string ("").

MemberSignature.Value: public void Close (ref object SaveChanges, ref object RouteDocument);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Close([in]object& SaveChanges, [in]object& RouteDocument) runtime managed
Public Sub Close (Optional ByRef SaveChanges As Object, Optional ByRef RouteDocument As Object)
abstract member Close : obj * obj -> unit

Docs.param: Optional Object. Specifies the save action for the document. Can be one of the following constants: wdDoNotSaveChanges, wdPromptToSaveChanges, or wdSaveChanges.
Optional Object. True to route the document to the next recipient. If the document doesn't have a routing slip attached, this argument is ignored.
Docs.summary: Closes the specified window.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Creator As Integer
public: property int Creator { int get(); };

Docs.summary: Returns a 32-bit integer that indicates the application in which the specified object was created.

remarks.para: If the object was created in Microsoft Word, this property returns the hexadecimal number 4D535744, which represents the string "MSWD." This value can also be represented by the constant wdCreatorCode.

The Creator property was primarily designed to be used on the Macintosh, where each application has a four-character creator code. For example, Microsoft Word has the creator code MSWD. For additional information about this property, consult the language reference Help included with Microsoft Office Macintosh Edition.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool DisplayHorizontalScrollBar { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Docs.summary: True if a horizontal scroll bar is displayed for the specified window.

Docs.summary: True if the vertical ruler appears on the right side of the document window in print layout view.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool DisplayRulers { bool get(); void set(bool value); };
member this.DisplayRulers : bool with get, set

Docs.summary: True if rulers are displayed for the specified window or pane.

remarks.para: The DisplayRulers property is equivalent to the Ruler command on the View menu.
Note If DisplayRulers is False, the horizontal and vertical rulers won't be displayed, regardless of the state of the property.

Docs.summary: True if comments, footnotes, endnotes, and hyperlinks are displayed as tips. Text marked as having comments is highlighted.

Docs.summary: True if a vertical ruler is displayed for the specified window or pane.

remarks.para: Note A vertical ruler appears only in print layout view, and only if the property is set to True.

member this.DisplayVerticalScrollBar : bool with get, set

Docs.summary: True if a vertical scroll bar is displayed for the specified window.

remarks.para: This property has no effect if the document isn't an e-mail message.

Docs.param: Required Integer. The variable name to which you want Microsoft Word to return the value for the left edge of the object.
Required Integer. The variable name to which you want Word to return the value for the top edge of the object.
Required Integer. The variable name to which you want Word to return the value for the width of the object.
Required Integer. The variable name to which you want Word to return the value for the height of the object.
Required Object. A or object.
Docs.summary: Returns the screen coordinates of the specified range or shape.

remarks.para: If the entire range or shape isn't visible on the screen, an error occurs.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property int Height { int get(); void set(int value); };
member this.Height : int with get, set

Docs.summary: Returns or sets the height of the window.

remarks.para: You cannot set this property if the window is maximized or minimized.
Use the property of the object to determine the maximum size for the window. Use the property to determine the window state.

public: property int Hwnd { int get(); };

MemberSignature.Value: public: property Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::WdIMEMode IMEMode { Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::WdIMEMode get(); void set(Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::WdIMEMode value); };
member this.IMEMode : Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.WdIMEMode with get, set

Docs.summary: Returns or sets the default start-up mode for the Japanese Input Method Editor (IME).

remarks.para: can be one of these WdIMEMode constants:
wdIMEModeAlpha – Activates the IME in half-width Latin mode.
wdIMEModeAlphaFull – Activates the IME in full-width Latin mode.
wdIMEModeHangul – Activates the IME in half-width Hangul mode.
wdIMEModeHangulFull – Activates the IME in full-width Hangul mode.
wdIMEModeHiragana – Activates the IME in full-width hiragana mode.
wdIMEModeKatakana – Activates the IME in full-width katakana mode.
wdIMEModeKatakanaHalf – Activates the IME in half-width katakana mode.
wdIMEModeNoControl – Does not change the IME mode.
wdIMEModeOff – Disables the IME and activates Latin text entry.
wdIMEModeOn – Activates the IME.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Index As Integer
public: property int Index { int get(); };

Docs.summary: Returns an Integer that represents the position of an item in a collection.

MemberSignature.Value: public void LargeScroll (ref object Down, ref object Up, ref object ToRight, ref object ToLeft);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void LargeScroll([in]object& Down, [in]object& Up, [in]object& ToRight, [in]object& ToLeft) runtime managed
Public Sub LargeScroll (Optional ByRef Down As Object, Optional ByRef Up As Object, Optional ByRef ToRight As Object, Optional ByRef ToLeft As Object)
abstract member LargeScroll : obj * obj * obj * obj -> unit

Docs.param: Optional Object. The number of screens to scroll the window down.
Optional Object. The number of screens to scroll the window up.
Optional Object. The number of screens to scroll the window to the right.
Optional Object. The number of screens to scroll the window to the left.
Docs.summary: Scrolls a window or pane by the specified number of screens.

remarks.para: The LargeScroll method is equivalent to clicking just before or just after the scroll boxes on the horizontal and vertical scroll bars.

If and are both specified, the window is scrolled by the difference of the arguments. For example, if is 2 and is 4, the window is scrolled up two screens. Similarly, if and are both specified, the window is scrolled by the difference of the arguments.
Any of these arguments can be a negative number. If no arguments are specified, the window is scrolled down one screen.

Docs.summary: Returns or sets an Integer that represents the horizontal position of the specified window, measured in points.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.Window NewWindow() runtime managed

Docs.summary: Opens a new window with the same document as the specified window.

remarks.para: Note A colon (:) and a number appear in the window caption when more than one window is open for a document.
If the NewWindow method is used with the object, a new window is opened for the active window.

public: property Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::Window ^ Next { Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::Window ^ get(); };

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void PageScroll([in]object& Down, [in]object& Up) runtime managed
Public Sub PageScroll (Optional ByRef Down As Object, Optional ByRef Up As Object)
abstract member PageScroll : obj * obj -> unit

Docs.param: Optional Object. The number of pages to be scrolled down. If this argument is omitted, this value is assumed to be 1.
Optional Object. The number of pages to be scrolled up.
Docs.summary: Scrolls through the specified pane or window page by page.

remarks.para: The PageScroll method is available only if you're in print layout view or web layout view. This method doesn't affect the position of the insertion point.
If and are both specified, the window is scrolled by the difference of the arguments. For example, if is 2 and is 4, the window is scrolled up two pages.

MemberSignature.Usage: window.PrintOut (Background, Append, Range, OutputFileName, From, To, Item, Copies, Pages, PageType, PrintToFile, Collate, ActivePrinterMacGX, ManualDuplexPrint, PrintZoomColumn, PrintZoomRow, PrintZoomPaperWidth, PrintZoomPaperHeight)

Docs.param: Optional Object. Set to True to have the macro continue while Microsoft Word prints the document.
Optional Object. Set to True to append the specified document to the file name specified by the argument. False to overwrite the contents of .
Optional Object. The page range. Can be any constant. wdPrintAllDocumentwdPrintCurrentPage wdPrintFromTo wdPrintRangeOfPages wdPrintSelection
Optional Object. If is True, this argument specifies the path and file name of the output file.
Optional Object. The starting page number when is set to wdPrintFromTo.
Optional Object. The ending page number when is set to wdPrintFromTo.

Optional Object. The item to be printed. Can be any constant.wdPrintAutoTextEntries wdPrintComments wdPrintDocumentContent wdPrintDocumentWithMarkup wdPrintEnvelope wdPrintKeyAssignments wdPrintMarkup wdPrintProperties wdPrintStyles
Optional Object. The number of copies to be printed.
Optional Object. The page numbers and page ranges to be printed, separated by commas. For example, "2, 6-10" prints page 2 and pages 6 through 10.
Optional Object. The type of pages to be printed. Can be any constant.wdPrintAllPages wdPrintEvenPagesOnly wdPrintOddPagesOnly
Optional Object. True to send printer instructions to a file. Make sure to specify a file name with .
Optional Object. When printing multiple copies of a document, True to print all pages of the document before printing the next copy.

Optional Object. This argument is available only in Microsoft Office Macintosh Edition. For additional information about this argument, consult the language reference Help included with Microsoft Office Macintosh Edition.

Optional Object. True to print a two-sided document on a printer without a duplex printing kit. If this argument is True, the and properties are ignored. Use the and properties to control the output during manual duplex printing. This argument may not be available to you, depending on the language support (U.S. English, for example) that you’ve selected or installed.
Optional Object. The number of pages you want Word to fit horizontally on one page. Can be 1, 2, 3, or 4. Use with the argument to print multiple pages on a single sheet.
Optional Object. The number of pages you want Word to fit vertically on one page. Can be 1, 2, or 4. Use with the argument to print multiple pages on a single sheet.
Optional Object. The width to which you want Word to scale printed pages, in twips (20 twips = 1 point; 72 points = 1 inch).
Optional Object. The height to which you want Word to scale printed pages, in twips (20 twips = 1 point; 72 points = 1 inch).
Docs.summary: Prints all or part of the specified document.

Docs.param: Required Object. A or object.

Optional Boolean. True if the top left corner of the range or shape appears at the top left corner of the document window. False if the bottom right corner of the range or shape appears at the bottom right corner of the document window. The default value is True.
Docs.summary: Scrolls through the document window so the specified range or shape is displayed in the document window.

remarks.para: If the range or shape is larger than the document window, the argument specifies which portion of the range or shape displays or gets initial focus. This method cannot be used with outline view.

Docs.summary: Returns the object that represents a selected range or the insertion point.

Docs.summary: Sets the focus of the specified document window to the body of an e-mail message.

remarks.para: If the document isn't an e-mail message, this method has no effect.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::WdShowSourceDocuments ShowSourceDocuments { Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::WdShowSourceDocuments get(); void set(Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::WdShowSourceDocuments value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets a constant that represents how Microsoft Office Word displays source documents after a compare and merge process. Read/write.

MemberSignature.Value: public void SmallScroll (ref object Down, ref object Up, ref object ToRight, ref object ToLeft);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void SmallScroll([in]object& Down, [in]object& Up, [in]object& ToRight, [in]object& ToLeft) runtime managed
Public Sub SmallScroll (Optional ByRef Down As Object, Optional ByRef Up As Object, Optional ByRef ToRight As Object, Optional ByRef ToLeft As Object)
abstract member SmallScroll : obj * obj * obj * obj -> unit

Docs.param: Optional Object. The number of lines to scroll the window down. A "line" corresponds to the distance scrolled by clicking the down scroll arrow on the vertical scroll bar once.
Optional Object. The number of lines to scroll the window up. A "line" corresponds to the distance scrolled by clicking the up scroll arrow on the vertical scroll bar once.
Optional Object. The number of lines to scroll the window to the right. A "line" corresponds to the distance scrolled by clicking the right scroll arrow on the horizontal scroll bar once.
Optional Object. The number of lines to scroll the window to the left. A "line" corresponds to the distance scrolled by clicking the left scroll arrow on the horizontal scroll bar once.
Docs.summary: Scrolls a window or pane by the specified number of lines.

remarks.para: This method is equivalent to clicking the scroll arrows on the horizontal and vertical scroll bars.

If and are both specified, the window is scrolled by the difference of the arguments. For example, if is 3 and is 6, the window is scrolled up three lines. Similarly, if and are both specified, the window is scrolled by the difference of the arguments.
Any of these arguments can be a negative number. If no arguments are specified, the window is scrolled down by one line.

Docs.summary: True if the window is split into multiple panes.

Docs.summary: Returns or sets the vertical split percentage for the specified window.

remarks.para: To remove the split, set this property to zero (0) or set the property to False.

member this.StyleAreaWidth : single with get, set

Docs.summary: Returns or sets the width of the style area in points.

remarks.para: When the StyleAreaWidth property is greater than 0 (zero), style names are displayed to the left of the text. The style area isn't visible in print layout or Web layout view.

remarks.para: If the ribbon is visible, the method hides it; if the ribbon is hidden, the method shows it.

Docs.summary: Returns the window type.

remarks.para: can be one of these WdWindowType constants:

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property UsableHeight As Integer
public: property int UsableHeight { int get(); };

Docs.summary: Returns the height (in points) of the active working area in the specified document window.

remarks.para: If none of the working area is visible in the document window, UsableHeight returns 1. To determine the actual available height, subtract 1 from the UsableHeight value.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property UsableWidth As Integer
public: property int UsableWidth { int get(); };

Docs.summary: Returns the width (in points) of the active working area in the specified document window.

remarks.para: If none of the working area is visible in the document window, UsableWidth returns 1. To determine the actual available height, subtract 1 from the UsableWidth value.

member this.Visible : bool with get, set

Docs.summary: True if the specified object is visible.

remarks.para: For any object, some methods and properties may be unavailable if the Visible property is False.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property int Width { int get(); void set(int value); };
member this.Width : int with get, set

Docs.summary: Returns or sets the width of the specified object, in points.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property WindowNumber As Integer
public: property int WindowNumber { int get(); };

Docs.summary: Returns the window number of the document displayed in the specified window. For example, if the caption of the window is "Sales.doc:2", this property returns the number 2.

remarks.para: Use the property to return the number of the specified window in the collection.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::WdWindowState WindowState { Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::WdWindowState get(); void set(Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::WdWindowState value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets the state of the specified document window or task window.

remarks.para: can be one of these WdWindowState constants:

The wdWindowStateNormal constant indicates a window that's not maximized or minimized. The state of an inactive window cannot be set. Use the method to activate a window prior to setting the window state.
